item.title: Error building on Windows 10
item.description:
Describe the issue I am attempting to build this plugin on windows. Following the instructions on the build page, I have cloned the repo and on attempting to run the build.py file, it errors with the following.

E:iles\USD\maya-usd>python build.py --maya-location \"C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Maya2020\" --pxrusd-location E:\downloads\usd-20-08-win64_py27_release --devkit-location E:\downloads\Autodesk_Maya_2020_2_Update_DEVKIT_Windows E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspace

    Building with settings:
      Source directory          E:iles\USD\maya-usd
      Workspace directory       E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspace
      Build directory           E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspaceuild\RelWithDebInfo
      Install directory         E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspace\install\RelWithDebInfo
      Variant                   RelWithDebInfo
      Python Debug              Off
      CMake generator           Default
      Build Log                 E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspaceuild\RelWithDebInfouild_log.txt
      Stages arguments          ['clean', 'configure', 'build', 'install']
#####################################################################################
log date: 2020-10-06 21:16
commit sha: f94bcfaa2884b5955169b379a24e6979fc38ee2e
commit date: Wed Sep 30 15:30:26 2020 -0400
#####################################################################################

cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=\"E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspace\install\RelWithDebInfo\" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo -DCMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS=ON -G \"Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64\" -DMAYA_LOCATION=\"C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Maya2020\" -DPXR_USD_LOCATION=\"E:\downloads\usd-20-08-win64_py27_release\" -DMAYA_DEVKIT_LOCATION=\"E:\downloads\Autodesk_Maya_2020_2_Update_DEVKIT_Windows\" -DMAYAUSD_DEFINE_BOOST_DEBUG_PYTHON_FLAG=OFF \"E:iles\USD\maya-usd\"
-- Selecting Windows SDK version  to target Windows 10.0.19041.
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:18 (project):
  Failed to run MSBuild command:

    MSBuild.exe

  to get the value of VCTargetsPath:

    The system cannot find the file specified



-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also \"E:/files/USD/maya-usd/workspace/build/RelWithDebInfo/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log\".

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File \"build.py\", line 602, in <module>
    BuildAndInstall(context, context.buildArgs, context.stagesArgs)
  File \"build.py\", line 371, in BuildAndInstall
    RunCMake(context, extraArgs, stagesArgs)
  File \"build.py\", line 277, in RunCMake
    extraArgs=(\" \".join(extraArgs) if extraArgs else \"\")))
  File \"build.py\", line 165, in Run
    .format(cmd=cmd, log=os.path.abspath(context.logFileLocation)))
RuntimeError: Failed to run 'cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=\"E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspace\install\RelWithDebInfo\" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo -DCMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS=ON -G \"Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64\" -DMAYA_LOCATION=\"C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Maya2020\" -DPXR_USD_LOCATION=\"E:\downloads\usd-20-08-win64_py27_release\" -DMAYA_DEVKIT_LOCATION=\"E:\downloads\Autodesk_Maya_2020_2_Update_DEVKIT_Windows\" -DMAYAUSD_DEFINE_BOOST_DEBUG_PYTHON_FLAG=OFF \"E:iles\USD\maya-usd\"'
See E:iles\USD\maya-usd\workspaceuild\RelWithDebInfouild_log.txt for more details.

Build log Build log and cmake output attached.
build_log.txt CMakeOutput.log

Specs: - Windows 10 - VS 2019 - Maya 2020 - Maya USD commit SHA master d9f5bd5

  • Pixar USD commit SHA binaries downloaded from https://developer.nvidia.com/usd

Additional context I have USD up and running using the binaries from nvidia. However I am not sure if that works with building this plugin for maya? Do I need to have the source for USD cloned and build to be able to use this plugin, or is there a way that I can use it in conjunction with the binaries from nvidia? I like to avoid having to go down the route of fully building USD on windows if I can. I have heard it is quite to journey!

item.title: Not sure im going the stage test correctly
item.description:
Describe the bug Please See attatched txt file. I am trying to run my build with –stage=test like this: python build.py --maya-location /usr/autodesk/maya2021 --pxrusd-location $SCRIPT_DIR/USD --devkit-location $SCRIPT_DIR/maya_devkit/devkitBase --stages=test $SCRIPT_DIR/WorkspaceRefractor alas it doesn’t do the test, looks pretty unhappy. Not sure whats up.

Attachments build_log.txt

Specs (if applicable): - OS & version [Linux centos 7.7] - Compiler & version [ gcc 6.3.1] - Maya version [Maya 2021/Maya beta PR117] - Maya USD commit SHA [ dev at 6210a2a] - Pixar USD commit SHA [20.08]

Additional context First time trying this in awhile has never worked for me before. Any help would be appreciated. Sue

item.title: WANT_UFE_BUILD scattered throughout build process
item.description:
Describe the issue WANT_UFE_BUILD can wind up controlling vtable layout and availability of functions. Currently it’s usage is scattered throughout CMake and headers in mayaUsd, hdMaya, mayaToHydra, AL-usdmaya. Usually as PRIVATE sometimes as PUBLIC (#583).

Seems better to be held in a spot where all sub-projects consume the value, and anyone building against a distribution can ingest the MACRO properly (i.e. in an installed CMake target).
